intro: Hybanthus peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces fruit that is capsule-like in structure. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
